div1.p: The writer thinks that Hanson is winning the fight against yellow fever in Peru.

div1.head: Letter to Wickliffe Rose, July 17 [1921?]
div1.opener:
From Dr. J. H. White
For Dr. Carter
COPY
Trujillo, Peru,
July 17 [1921?]
Dear Dr. Rose:
div1.p:
Just a hurried line before Hanson and I start on inspection.
Altho I have not seen any actual work, I think I am justified in saying
that Hansen is winning his fight and will in all probability report his
last case in a few days - but I am sure that the present index in this
city of one per cent should be maintained and it should be attained and
maintained in all of the towns of northern Peru, for at least a year,
and then God willing we can say that the west coast of South America
is freed entirely of Yellow Fever. Hansen is sending Corrigan south to
Viru today to sterilize the district on north side of the 50 mile district
between desert between here and Lima, - excellent strategy - and we are
going north tomorrow or perhaps Wednesday to the field of the big
epidemic (Lambayeque) and institute a final and if possible absolute
sterilization at Farrenafe and other points.
